intro: Brickellia verbenacea, commonly known as green brickellbush, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Brickellia verbenacea is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
